cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 450 miles south of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north tonight, then accelerate north-northeast on Wednesday, making landfall on the northern Gulf Coast and sweeping northeast across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic before moving offshore early Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast between Morgan City and the Mississippi/Alabama border

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch west of Morgan City to Intracoastal City, LA
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning Morgan City, LA to MS/AL border; Tropical Storm Warning MS/AL border to Okaloosa/Walton Co. line, FL; Storm-Surge Warning Mouth of Atchafalaya River, LA to Navarre, FL and adjacent bays
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast Wednesday then inland across the Southeast and Mid-Atlantic, including DE, MD, VA coasts late Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds late Thursday could reach 35–45 mph (near-gale to minimal tropical-storm force) with low (14 %) probability of sustained 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal surge of 1–2 ft possible along the Delaware Bay and lower Delaware River.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain expected Thursday–Friday with a risk of localized flash/urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief, isolated tornadoes cannot be ruled out; elevated river levels and reduced visibility may disrupt port operations.
